edu.govschool.govchat.socket

Class GCServerSocket

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.govschool.govchat.socket.GCGenericSocket
      • edu.govschool.govchat.socket.GCServerSocket
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GCSocketListener

    public class GCServerSocket
extends GCGenericSocket
implements GCSocketListener
    Server socket implementation for GovChat. Based on Oracle documentation. This socket will act as the central server for our application. Our server will instantiate an instance of this class for use.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class edu.govschool.govchat.socket.GCGenericSocket

    • Constructor Detail

      • GCServerSocket

        public GCServerSocket(GCSocketListener fxListener,
                      int port)
        Default constructor. Creates an instance of our server socket on the given port
        Parameters:
        fxListener - the listener instance to talk to our GUI
        port - the port to bind to

      • GCServerSocket

        public GCServerSocket(GCSocketListener fxListener)
        Debug constructor. Creates an instance of our server socket on the default port of 2000
        Parameters:
        fxListener - the listener instance to talk to our GUI

    • Method Detail

      • onMessage

        public void onMessage(java.lang.String line)
        Read a message sent over the socket. All we have to do is send the message to our GUI to display, but we could do other things with it here.
        Specified by:
        onMessage in interface GCSocketListener
        Parameters:
        line - the received message

      • onCloseUpdate

        public void onCloseUpdate(java.lang.Boolean isClosed)
        Change the connection status of the socket. All we have to do again is inform the GUI.
        Specified by:
        onCloseUpdate in interface GCSocketListener
        Parameters:
        isClosed - true if we're closed, false otherwise

      • initConnection

        public void initConnection()
                    throws java.net.SocketException
        Description copied from class: GCGenericSocket
        Initialize the socket connection. The client and server sockets will initialize different, so this method is left as abstract, to be implemented in the subclasses.
        Specified by:
        initConnection in class GCGenericSocket
        Throws:
        java.net.SocketException - the connection could not be created

      • closeAdditionalSockets

        public void closeAdditionalSockets()
        Description copied from class: GCGenericSocket
        Closes any outstanding connections. In case our subclasses create more than one socket, we'll close them here.
        Specified by:
        closeAdditionalSockets in class GCGenericSocket
